item.title: Npcs telling online status
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

[quote="`Ganon, post:2, topic:293427"][quote author=capinp00nnzz link=topic=388279.msg2902675#msg2902675 date=1249614142]
i nedd help making the code for an npc to stand in front of the training area and say whether or not im online. i have a code in npc handler but i dont kniow if its right, the npc guys wont show up heres my code pls help.

npcs[i].updateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true; if (PlayerHandler.isPlayerOn("i komok i")) { npcs[i].textUpdate = "komok is ONLINE"; } else { npcs[i].textUpdate = "komok is OFFLINE"; } }
[/quote]

You will have to spawn the NPC using whatever your spawn method is in your source. Most bases use a CFG file to spawn npcs, although I depreciate this method.[/quote]What’s there to depreciate about it? I think it’s made just fine; though, it could be better if MoparScapers actually learned to use a database. The CFG file for spawning NPCs is one of the ONLY things mopar servers load on server start-up and cache instead of searching through the CFG file again every time they need to be spawned.

Read full topic

item.title: Npcs telling online status
item.dc:creator: @_Ganon `Ganon
item.description:
@_Ganon wrote:

[quote=“capinp00nnzz, post:1, topic:293427”]i nedd help making the code for an npc to stand in front of the training area and say whether or not im online. i have a code in npc handler but i dont kniow if its right, the npc guys wont show up heres my code pls help.

npcs[i].updateRequired = true; npcs[i].textUpdateRequired = true; if (PlayerHandler.isPlayerOn("i komok i")) { npcs[i].textUpdate = "komok is ONLINE"; } else { npcs[i].textUpdate = "komok is OFFLINE"; } }[/quote]

You will have to spawn the NPC using whatever your spawn method is in your source. Most bases use a CFG file to spawn npcs, although I depreciate this method.

Read full topic
